column9: Have been taking for over 13 years, Dilantin was first prescribed and didn't seem to have noticable side effects. Insurance soon forced me to use generic phenytoin by refusing to pay for dilantin, which became unaffordable. Since taking Phenytoin Sodium Extended Caps at the rate of 800mg a day, (400mg am & 400 pm) I haven't felt like my old self in years. Who makes this stuff anyway?

column2: jazzynan, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have taken Dilantin or its generic for over 35 years now.  I have had 10 seizures total and only when I have mistaken, tried to change medication (by doctor suggestion), or had one too many drinks!!!I take 350 MG daily with virtually no side effects-no gum problems-however, I am 59 and sometimes have memory problems, but that could be due to my age!!!!

column2: savedbygrace, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a grand mal seizure (on my anniversary) which left me bruised from falling down. I was given Dilantin to help avoid a reoccuring episode and so far so good. Thank you, Jesus!

column2: johnson0184, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
winesong, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: July'07 I suffered a hemorrhagic stroke accompanied by a grand mal seizure. I was prescribed phenytoin for approx. 6 weeks and allowed off the drug. Aug'08 I had a single mild seizure episode and have been taking 460mg. daily. along with 1000mg. keppra. I have not had anymore episodes, yet the side effects have been difficulty with short term memory, restless sleeping, slight mood swings and obvious problems with putting words together. I had been known for my articulation and excellent speaking abilities yet today I am very concerned with my inability to construct sentences. This may very well be aftereffects of the seizure, and or stroke. But I have gone this past year without these symptoms until the latest seizure and continued use of the current medications. I am also taking hypertension meds. and exercising regularly, along with a major reduction in alcohol consumption. I enjoy a glass of wine with dinner 2 to 3 times a week. I feel great yet the lack of proper sleep is evasive to everyday life. The further I investigate these drugs the more I am suspicious of the phenytoin. At this time and point I must say though, the risks of stopping the prescribed doses against reoccurring seizure far outweigh a reason to stop the drugs.
